intro: Pterocaulon rugosum, commonly known as the rough-stemmed pterocaulon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its woody, branched stems covered in rough, ridged textures. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in coastal and sandy soils, often found in shrubland or coastal dunes. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
